CONJUGATES: jobs (n. plural) | jobs (v. 3rd pers. sing.) | jobbing (v. present participle) | jobbed (v. past tense, past participle)

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A paid position of regular employment.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一份有报酬的固定工作或职位。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She applied for a new job in marketing.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她申请了一份新的市场营销工作。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: do a good/bad job | a difficult job
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A task or piece of work, especially one that needs to be done.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一项任务或一件需要完成的工作。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: It was a difficult job to clean the entire house by myself.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 独自打扫整个房子是一项艰巨的任务。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: do a job on [sth/sb] | a repair job
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An act or operation performed; an instance of doing something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一项操作或行为；一次做某事的例子。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The mechanic did a good job on my car engine.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 机械师把我的汽车发动机修得很好。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: a bank job | pull off a job
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A criminal act, especially a robbery.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一项犯罪活动，尤指抢劫。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The gang planned a big bank job for next month.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 那个帮派计划下个月进行一次大型银行抢劫。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To do casual or occasional work; to work by the job.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 从事临时或零星工作；按件计酬。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He jobbed as a gardener during the summer holidays.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他在暑假期间做园丁的零工。

REGISTER: Common in everyday speech, professional contexts, and informal settings. Some meanings are slang or specific to certain subcultures.
